dungeon

Class DungeonGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeon.DungeonGenerator

  • public class DungeonGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    A dungeon generator creates a path through a dungeon, connecting its entrance to one or multiple exits. The generator starts from the entrance and adds room in random directions to create a main path, and then add secondary path of variable length along the main path.
    Author:
    lucasmouradeoliveira

    • Constructor Detail

      • DungeonGenerator

        public DungeonGenerator(int nbRoomsBeginToEnd,
                        Dungeon dungeon,
                        int currentLvl)
        Creates a new generator for the dungeon.
        Parameters:
        nbRoomsBeginToEnd - the number of room between the beginning and the end of the dungeon.
        dungeon - the dungeon to generate.
        currentLvl - the current level of the dungeon.

    • Method Detail

      • generateMainPath

        public void generateMainPath()
        Generates the main path of the dungeon, a succession of rooms connected one by one. The main path is always visible and only goes to the 4 cardinal points North, South, West and East.

      • generateSecondaryPath

        public void generateSecondaryPath()
        Generates secondary rooms outside of the main path, some of them being hidden. The secondary rooms are connected to the main path and may contain treasures, monsters or traps.

      • generateNeighbors

        public java.util.ArrayList<Room> generateNeighbors(Room current,
                                                   int nb)
        Generates a certain amount of adjacent rooms to a room, in random direction, and link them to it.
        Parameters:
        current - the room from which to generate adjacent rooms.
        nb - the depth of the room, relative to its path.
        Returns:
        the list of generated adjacent rooms.

      • getRandomRoomType

        public Room getRandomRoomType(int nb)
        Returns an instance of a room chosen from a list of different types. The random room can be null, which allows the secondary path generation algorithm to have an end.
        Parameters:
        nb - the depth of the room you want to generate relative to the beginning of its path.
        Returns:
        a random type of room, from the following : - simple room - trap room - dragon room - treasure room - none

      • hasPath

        public boolean hasPath()
        Returns:
        true if the dungeon has a path from the entrance to the exit.

      • getPath

        public java.util.Stack<Room> getPath()
        Returns:
        a pile of rooms, going from the exit of the dungeon to the entrance.

      • getDungeon

        public Dungeon getDungeon()
        Returns:
        the dungeon
